results.title: Potential Ketoacidosis Linked to Imeglimin and Metformin Co-administration in a Patient With Type 2 Diabetes
results.text_hl: Therefore, the combination of @CHEMICAL_imeglimin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C575881 @@@imeglimin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ might have precipitated the development of @<m>DISEASE_Ketosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007662 @@@ketoacidosis@@@.

citations.NLM: Yamagishi H, Hoshino S, Hirano A, Oshima A, Imai T. Potential Ketoacidosis Linked to Imeglimin and Metformin Co-administration in a Patient With Type 2 Diabetes Cureus. 2023 Jun;15(6):e40702. PMID: 37485200

results.title: A Rare Case of Metformin-Induced Lactic Acidosis and Concomitant Euglycemic Ketoacidosis.
results.text_hl: A Rare Case of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@-Induced @DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@Lactic Acidosis@@@ and Concomitant @<m>DISEASE_Ketosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007662 @@@Euglycemic Ketoacidosis@@@.

results.title: Mottling as an Early Sign of Euglycemic Ketoacidosis Induced by SGLT-2 Inhibitors.
results.journal: Eur J Case Rep Intern Med
results.text_hl: Mottling as an Early Sign of @<m>DISEASE_Ketosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007662 @@@Euglycemic Ketoacidosis@@@ Induced by @GENE_SLC5A2 @GENE_6524 @@@SGLT-2@@@ Inhibitors.

results.title: Severe lactic acidosis with euglycemic diabetic ketoacidosis due to metformin overdose.
results.text_hl: We propose that not only @DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@ but also @<m>DISEASE_Ketosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007662 @@@ketoacidosis@@@ is one of the important pathological conditions in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ @DISEASE_Drug_Overdose @DISEASE_MESH:D062787 @@@overdose@@@.

citations.NLM: Kuno H, Fujimaru T, Kadota N, Konishi K, Sekiguchi M, Watanabe K, Ito Y, Nagahama M, Taki F, Hifumi T, Otani N, Nakayama M. Severe lactic acidosis with euglycemic diabetic ketoacidosis due to metformin overdose. CEN Case Rep. 2023 Mar 19;():. PMID: 36934381

results.title: Shared Pathogenic Features Between Serotonin Receptor Antagonist-Associated Diabetic Ketosis and Ketosis-Prone Type 2 Diabetes: A Case Report.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1 @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@Ketosis-prone type 2 diabetes@@@ (@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1 @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@KPD@@@) is characterized by male predominance, onset at a young age, @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obesity@@@, and sudden onset of @DISEASE_Diabetic_Ketoacidosis @DISEASE_MESH:D016883 @@@diabetic ketosis@@@/@<m>DISEASE_Ketosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007662 @@@ketoacidosis@@@ without precipitating factors, negative anti-islet autoantibodies, and beta-cell function preservation after recovery from @DISEASE_Diabetic_Ketoacidosis @DISEASE_MESH:D016883 @@@diabetic ketosis@@@/@<m>DISEASE_Ketosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007662 @@@ketoacidosis@@@ following temporal @CHEMICAL_Insulin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007328 @@@insulin@@@ therapy.

citations.NLM: Nakanishi S, Sato H, Oikawa Y, Ikebukuro K, Shimada A. Shared Pathogenic Features Between Serotonin Receptor Antagonist-Associated Diabetic Ketosis and Ketosis-Prone Type 2 Diabetes: A Case Report. Cureus. 2025 Apr;17(4):e82833. PMID: 40416155
citations.BibTeX: @article{40416155, title={Shared Pathogenic Features Between Serotonin Receptor Antagonist-Associated Diabetic Ketosis and Ketosis-Prone Type 2 Diabetes: A Case Report.}, author={Nakanishi S and Sato H and Oikawa Y and Ikebukuro K and Shimada A}, journal={Cureus}, volume={17}, number={4}, pages={e82833}}

results.title: Metformin Is Associated with the Inhibition of Renal Artery AT1R/ET-1/iNOS Axis in a Rat Model of Diabetic Nephropathy with Suppression of Inflammation and Oxidative Stress and Kidney Injury
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@Diabetes@@@ significantly (p < 0.0001) modulated renal artery tissue levels of @GENE_AGTR1A @GENE_24180 @@@AT1R@@@, @GENE_EDN1 @GENE_24323 @@@ET-1@@@, @GENE_NOS2 @GENE_24599 @@@inducible nitric oxide synthase@@@ (@GENE_NOS2 @GENE_24599 @@@iNOS@@@), @GENE_NOS3 @GENE_24600 @@@endothelial NOS@@@ (@GENE_NOS3 @GENE_24600 @@@eNOS@@@), and the @DISEASE_Sleep_Disorders_Circadian_Rhythm @DISEASE_MESH:D020178 @@@advanced glycation@@@ end products that were protected by @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@. In addition, @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@-induced @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@, oxidative stress, @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Ketosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007662 @@@ketonuria@@@, mesangial matrix expansion, and kidney collagen were significantly reduced by @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Dawood AF, Maarouf A, Alzamil NM, Momenah MA, Shati AA, Bayoumy NM, Kamar SS, Haidara MA, ShamsEldeen AM, Yassin HZ, Hewett PW, Al-Ani B. Metformin Is Associated with the Inhibition of Renal Artery AT1R/ET-1/iNOS Axis in a Rat Model of Diabetic Nephropathy with Suppression of Inflammation and Oxidative Stress and Kidney Injury Biomedicines. 2022 Jul 8;10(7):. PMID: 35884947

results.title: Metformin Associated Lactic Acidosis in the Intensive Care Unit: A Rare Condition Mimicking Sepsis
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@MALA@@@ can occur any time a @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ on @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ suffers disruption in renal function resulting in the accumulation of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Sendil S, Yarlagadda K, Lawal H, Nookala V, Shingala H. Metformin Associated Lactic Acidosis in the Intensive Care Unit: A Rare Condition Mimicking Sepsis Cureus. 2020 Jul 10;12(7):e9119. PMID: 32699722

results.title: Glycemic Outcomes of Second-Line Diabetes Drug Choice in a Real-World Population
results.journal: Mayo Clin Proc Innov Qual Outcomes
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Hypoglycemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@Hypoglycemia and@@@ @DISEASE_Acute_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000208 @@@acute metabolic complications@@@ (@DISEASE_Acute_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000208 @@@AMCs@@@; @<m>DISEASE_Ketosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007662 @@@ketoacidosis@@@, @DISEASE_Hyperglycemic_Hyperosmolar_Nonketotic_Coma @DISEASE_MESH:D006944 @@@hyperosmolarity@@@, and @DISEASE_Coma @DISEASE_MESH:D003128 @@@coma@@@) are glycemic outcomes that have high cost and high morbidity; these outcomes must be taken into consideration when choosing initial second-line therapy after @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Wallia A, O'Brien MJ, Liss DT, Kang RH, Cooper AJ, Gilmer A, Ackermann RT. Glycemic Outcomes of Second-Line Diabetes Drug Choice in a Real-World Population Mayo Clin Proc Innov Qual Outcomes. 2021 Jun;5(3):675-681. PMID: 34195559

results.title: COVID-19 in diabetic patients: Related risks and specifics of management
results.text_hl: There are currently no recommendations in favour of discontinuing antihypertensive medications that interact with the @GENE_REN @GENE_5972 @@@renin@@@-angiotensin-@CHEMICAL_Aldosterone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000450 @@@aldosterone@@@ system. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ and SGLT2 inhibitors should be discontinued in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with severe forms of @DISEASE_COVID_19 @DISEASE_MESH:D000086382 @@@COVID-19@@@ owing to the risks of @DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Ketosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007662 @@@ketoacidosis@@@.

citations.NLM: Orioli L, Hermans MP, Thissen JP, Maiter D, Vandeleene B, Yombi JC. COVID-19 in diabetic patients: Related risks and specifics of management Ann Endocrinol (Paris). 2020 Jun;81(2-3):101-109. PMID: 32413342
citations.BibTeX: @article{32413342, title={COVID-19 in diabetic patients: Related risks and specifics of management}, author={Orioli L and Hermans MP and Thissen JP and Maiter D and Vandeleene B and Yombi JC}, journal={Ann Endocrinol (Paris)}, volume={81}, number={2-3}, pages={101-109}}
